alert.note: Alert for Aiken; Edgefield; Fairfield; Lexington; McCormick; Newberry; Richland; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 11:01AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McDuffie, Columbia, southeastern Lincoln, central Richmond, south central Fairfield, southern Newberry, Edgefield, northwestern Lexington, northwestern Aiken, Saluda, southeastern McCormick and northwestern Richland Counties through 1145 AM EDT... At 1100 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Lake Greenwood State Park to Warrenton. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Thomson, Batesburg-Leesville, Fort Gordon, Augusta, Martinez, Belvedere, Clearwater, Edgefield, Saluda, Harlem, Johnston, Prosperity, Ridge Spring, Glendale, South Augusta, Clarks Hill Recreation Area and Edgefield County Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 167 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 15. Interstate 26 between mile markers 89 and 97. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 18 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Aiken; Edgefield; Fairfield; Lexington; McCormick; Newberry; Richland; Saluda
